text: The Staten Island Zoo is a zoo in Staten Island, New York. It has over 443 animals of over 206 species. It opened on June 10, 1936. At the time of its opening, it was considered the first "educational zoo" in the United States. The zoo is known for its large collection of rattlesnakes. The zoo's collection is one of the largest rattlesnake collections in North America. It is the home of Staten Island Chuck, a groundhog who is New York City's official Groundhog Day forecaster. ==References== ==Other websites== *Staten Island Zoo website Category:1936 establishments in the United States Category:Buildings and structures in New York City Category:Zoos in the United States Zoo Category:1930s establishments in New York (state)
title: Staten Island Zoo
